ChecklistItem1.content: Perform an analysis of dependent failures and their effects according to ISO 26262-9:2018, Clause 7.

ChecklistItem2.content: Document the findings and outcomes of the dependent failures analysis.

ChecklistItem3.content: Include details on how software safety requirements rely on freedom from interference or sufficient independence between software components.

ChecklistItem4.content: Ensure compliance with the guidelines provided in Annex E and ISO 26262-9:2018, Annex C regarding analyses of dependent failures at the software architectural level.

ChecklistItem5.content: Implement a process to review and update the dependent failures analysis report regularly to reflect any changes or updates in the software safety requirements.

ChecklistItem1.content: Conduct safety-oriented analysis at the software architectural level as per ISO 26262-9:2018, Clause 8.

ChecklistItem2.content: Provide evidence of the software's suitability to provide specified safety-related functions and properties for the respective ASIL.

ChecklistItem3.content: Identify or confirm the safety-related parts of the software.

ChecklistItem4.content: Support the specification and verify the effectiveness of safety measures, including safety mechanisms derived from safety-oriented analyses.

ChecklistItem5.content: Refer to Annex E for additional guidance on safety-oriented analysis at the software architectural level and selection of appropriate safety measures.

ChecklistItem1.content: Ensure the software architectural design addresses characteristics such as comprehensibility, consistency, simplicity, verifiability, modularity, abstraction, encapsulation, and maintainability as per ISO 26262-2018:6-7.4.1

ChecklistItem2.content: Apply safety mechanisms for error detection and error handling based on safety-oriented analyses at the software architectural level in accordance with ISO 26262-2018:6-7.4.12

ChecklistItem3.content: Estimate required resources for the embedded software including execution time, storage space, and communication resources as per ISO 26262-2018:6-7.4.13

ChecklistItem4.content: Verify the software architectural design in accordance with ISO 26262-8:2018, Clause 9 to ensure it meets specified objectives and design guidelines as per ISO 26262-2018:6-7.4.14a and 6-7.4.14b

ChecklistItem5.content: Consider factors such as verifiability, suitability for configurable software, feasibility, testability, and maintainability during the development of the software architectural design as per ISO 26262-2018:6-7.4.2

ChecklistItem6.content: Ensure the software architectural design exhibits characteristics like comprehensibility, consistency, simplicity, verifiability, modularity, encapsulation, and maintainability based on the principles listed in ISO 26262-2018:6-7.4.3

ChecklistItem7.content: Develop the software architectural design down to the level where software units are identified as per ISO 26262-2018:6-7.4.4

ChecklistItem8.content: Describe the static and dynamic design aspects of the software architectural elements including software structure, data types, external interfaces, global variables, and dynamic behaviors as per ISO 26262-2018:6-7.4.5

ChecklistItem9.content: Allocate software safety requirements hierarchically to software components down to software units and ensure compliance with the highest ASIL of any allocated requirement as per ISO 26262-2018:6-7.4.6

ChecklistItem10.content: Qualify pre-existing software architectural elements used for safety requirements in accordance with ISO 26262-8:2018, Clause 12 if not developed following ISO 26262 series of standards as per ISO 26262-2018:6-7.4.7
